definition: superfluous/redundant/cumbersome/refers to a son-in-law living with wife's family

sentences.english: And let there be no mistake: The blood is definitely running right now on Wall Street.
sentences.chinese: 毋庸赘言，现在华尔街的确已经是血流成河了。
写作清晰，务必精简，避免赘言。

sentences.english: Is this yet another necessary tautology?
sentences.chinese: 这是另一种必需的赘言吗？

sentences.english: Health care reform must happen this year.
sentences.chinese: 无须赘言，事不宜迟，这项改革年内一定会展开。

sentences.english: If investment was decisive the outcome would already be known.
sentences.chinese: 如果说投入决定一切，那么结果本应已无需赘言。

sentences.english: The blood is definitely running right now on Wall Street.
sentences.chinese: 毋庸赘言，现在华尔街的确已经是血流成河了。

sentences.english: Needless to say, some tongues are more versatile than others.
sentences.chinese: 无庸赘言，有些语言更具多样性。

sentences.english: The importance of talents has been no doubt.
sentences.chinese: 人才的重要性已经无庸赘言。

sentences.english: The first step toward verbosity is  improving your vocabulary.
sentences.chinese: 赘言的第一步要提高你的词汇量。

sentences.english: Whatever you’re wearing, it goes without saying that it needs to be clean.
sentences.chinese: 不管你穿什么，无需赘言，都必须穿戴干净。

sentences.english: Write clearly. Be concise. Avoid wordiness.
sentences.chinese: 写作清晰，务必精简，避免赘言。

sentences.english: Clean backgrounds, needless to say, are one of the key elements of a successful portrait.
sentences.chinese: 毋庸赘言，干净的背景是拍摄成功人像的关键因素。
写作清晰，务必精简，避免赘言。

sentences.english: Provides several verbosity levels for a better user experience.
sentences.chinese: 提供一些赘言水平给一种较好的使用者经验。

definition: to say more than is necessary/to give unnecessary details
need not/does not have to/not necessarily
it goes without saying/it is self-evident
to make reference to/to write about
needless to say/it goes without saying
to offer an opinion/to comment (on the issue)/to have a say (in the matter)
